HISTORICAL GROWTH OF THE CHARAC- TERS OF PHARISEE AND SADDUCEE

AN authoritative account of the sects of Pharisee and Sadducee may now be gathered by every English reader from the works of Edersheim and the trans- lated books of Schfirer and Kuenen. It is remarkable, more especially with regard to the Pharisees and Scribes, that no charge of falsity and immorality is brought against them as a body except as the denunciation of Jesus may be quoted to imply such charge.
